name: for more
description:
This is 'for more', a new video game from Outhouse Media. It's a must have for any fans of the game or anyone looking for a new way to play. The story is set in the 1980's and follows one of the game's cast of characters.
'For more' is a quick one to put on, and you'll have a blast. From that clip it's fairly clear that the game is aimed at a younger demographic but it's all very well trying to appeal to folks who say, 'I know I'm a teen but I can still play a story game.' As someone who loves to play RPGs it'll be refreshing to combine a puzzle-based roleplaying game with something a little different. Gameplay wise, the game is straightforward and straight forward. The four in-game characters include 'King Larry' at the centre of things and Gossamer, the man with a crazy golden uppity hard hat. After turning four, the game requires you to complete five different tasks. These can all be done in succession but each game is different and you can pick and choose from them. The four in-game characters include 'King Larry' at the centre of things and Gossamer, the man with a crazy golden uppity hard hat. Blowing out the lights you enter an area called 'The Palace', a private viewing area for the game's stars. This is where you'll find the games ending cut scenes.
